page.title: 13Godwin's Peat Works (3)
page.content:
5 tons of peat can be fertilised in one hour.
{5. THE BAGGING.} At Godwin's Peat Works peat is bagged and sold at the Works for people who live locally. Peat is also packed for stores such as Great Mills, Cuthbert's (i.e. Woolworth's), Sainsbury's and Cooton's of Chelmsford in Essex. They bag seed and potting compost, lawn peat, lawn top dressing, grow fibre, peat alone and they produce grow bags. At Godwin's Peat Works there are four large rooms used for bagging. There is a machine that holds a large roll of polythene bags. Each bag is cut off the roll, filled with peat and then sealed. It drops onto a conveyor belt where it is moved under a roller
